com.projetloki.genesis

Class FontFace

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.FontFace

  • public final class FontFace
extends Object
    The font-face rule allows authors to specify online fonts to display text on their web pages. By allowing authors to provide their own fonts, font-face eliminates the need to depend on the limited number of fonts users have installed on their computers.

    Example: 

     static final FontFace MY_GENTIUM = FontFace.forLocalSource("myGentium")
     .sourceAdded("../Gentium.ttf")
     .withFamilyName("myGentium");

 static final CssModule MY_MODULE = new CssModule() {
   @Override public void configure(CssBuilder out) {
     // Add the font-face to the CSS
     out.use(myGentium);

     // Apply the newly-defined font to all elements of type p
     out.addRule("p", "font-family: myGentium");
   }
 };

    In order to exist in the generated CSS, every font-face must be registered with CssBuilder.use(FontFace).

    Font-faces are immutable. Methods such as sourceAdded(String) perform a copy of the instance they are called on, modify the copy and return it. The original instance is left unchanged.

    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux
    See Also:
    MDN, Browser support

    • Method Detail

      • forSource

        public static FontFace forSource(String sourceUri)
        Returns a new font-face that contains a single source. The browser will download the font at the given URI.

        If you know it, it is recommended that you specify the format of the font file.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given string is not a valid URI

      • forSource

        public static FontFace forSource(String sourceUri,
                 FontFormat format)
        Returns a new font-face that contains a single source. The browser will download the font at the given URI.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given string is not a valid URI

      • forLocalSource

        public static FontFace forLocalSource(String localName)
        Returns a new font-face that contains a single local source.

      • sourceAdded

        public FontFace sourceAdded(String sourceUri)
        Returns a new font-face that is a copy of this instance, with the given source URI added. The browser will download the font at the given URI. If the first source is not available, the browser will check the second source, and so on.

        If you know it, it is recommended that you specify the format of the font file.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given string is not a valid URI

      • sourceAdded

        public FontFace sourceAdded(String sourceUri,
                   FontFormat format)
        Returns a new font-face that is a copy of this instance, with the given source URI added. The browser will download the font at the given URI. If the first source is not available, the browser will check the second source, and so on.

      • localSourceAdded

        public FontFace localSourceAdded(String localName)
        Returns a new font-face that is a copy of this instance, with the given local source added. When authors would prefer to use a locally available copy of a given font and download it if it's not, this method can be used.
        Parameters:
        localName - the name of the local font

      • italic

        public FontFace italic()
        Returns a new font-face that is a copy of this instance, and that specifies italic style.

      • oblique

        public FontFace oblique()
        Returns a new font-face that is a copy of this instance, and that specifies italic style.

      • smallCaps

        public FontFace smallCaps()
        Returns a new font-face that is a copy of this instance, and that specifies small-caps variant.

      • bold

        public FontFace bold()
        Returns a new font-face that is a copy of this instance, and that specifies bold weight.

      • familyName

        public String familyName()
        Returns the family name of this font-face. This is the string you must pass to Properties.Builder.setFontFamily(FontFamilyFallback, String...).

        If you haven't explicitly specified a family name with withFamilyName(String), one will be generated automatically.

      • withFamilyName

        public FontFace withFamilyName(String name)
        Returns a new font-face that is a copy of this instance, and with the given family name. If you don't specify a family name, one will be generated automatically. Call this method if you want to refer to the family name outside of the CSS, e.g. in HTML or Javascript.
